ref: 8469 *pragāmaka ʻ yearling ʼ. [Cf. Mj. fragomïy ʻ kid ʼ fr. *pragāma -- in Par. rhagåm ʻ springtime ʼ Rep2 67 and EVP 89 rather than with Tomaschek Centralasiatische Studien ii 765 cf. Gk. ta\ pro/bata which E. Benveniste BSL xlv 92 interprets as ʻ those moving in front ʼ. <-> √gam]
Pr. pāmə ʻ kid, lamb ʼ, pumók ʻ new -- born lamb ʼ.
